all_paragraphs: “I took the one less traveled by,And that has made all the difference.” — by Robert Frost
No one even had a clue that these iconic lines by Robert Frost would be the secret of success for the travel industry. And Big Data is here to make all the difference for the travel industry.

With every industry taking the path of Big Data Analytics, the travel industry is amongst the ones who are less traveled by this road. With Big Data into the picture, it is taking the travel industry to places. Big Data will provide you with a traveling experience like never before. It will leave no stone unturned in the travel industry.
Enjoy Your Adventure Ride Into the Big Data World
Let’s go on a short trip to see how Big Data is nurturing your traveling experience.

Jobs fill your pockets and traveling fill your soul, but there are still some loopholes. And Big Data is here to fill those. Traveling is to explore different places and Big Data is here to explore an array of opportunities that will soon revolutionize the travel industry. Big Data is here to ensure a stress-free traveling experience for all the people who are consumed by wanderlust.
Here are few areas where Big Data is proving to vital for the travel industry-
It’s the Right Time to Make the Big Move

Imagine a situation where the travel app in your smartphone tracks your location and recognizes that you are near a popular tourist location, so in the very next minute it starts sending you special offers or deals in the nearby hotels, restaurants, etc. which can help you in saving your money. Additionally, it can suggest some other nearby places that are worth visiting. We now have our personal travel assistant. What else do we need?A lot of money to travel. Lol.
Get Comfortable with the Oldest and the Best Companion of Big Data

Air travel is time-saving but is also nerve-racking at times. Multiple security checks, compacts seats in the coaches, lost luggage and delayed connecting flights — it tests your patience at every point of the journey. But Big Data Analytics is here to give this pain relief as it is set to revolutionize your travel experience.

Heathrow Airport in collaboration with Yael Grushka-Cockayne, a visiting associate professor at Harvard Business School, and some other researchers from University College London decided to eradicate the major problem of painful connecting flights.
The major issue they faced was the inability of their legacy systems to communicate effectively.

The stakeholders at Heathrow planned to upgrade there existing data systems at the airport with the aim to better utilize its customer’s data to enhance the experience of passengers of connecting flights, who accounted for one-third of all the travelers who pass through Heathrow annually.

Their goal was to develop a system that could both identify the connecting passengers and also accurately predict their transfer time. This could only be made possible by accumulating the data from multiple sources and then analyzing it in real-time.

They observed some amazing results just two years after the live trial started. The mean absolute error of passenger flow assumptions declined over twenty percent after leveraging Big Data Analytics. And since then, the stakeholders at Heathrow have pursued and trusted Big Data Analytics more than anything else.

After accomplishing this project at Heathrow Airport, Grushka-Cockayne and her team have received invitations from some of the biggest airport representatives in the world such as Paris, Singapore, Los Angeles, and more planning to implement similar systems at their own facilities.

Big Data is here to foster the travel industry and with an aim to take it to greater heights. The insights gained through Big Data Analytics is helping the travel businesses to enhance the traveling experience for their customers. It is on the verge of acquiring the window seat of the travel industry.
